title: Vasyl Lomachenko backs Oleksandr Usyk to beat Deontay Wilder should they fight in future
text:
Vasyl Lomachenko has boldly predicted that Oleksandr Usyk would 'school' heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder if they go head-to-head in the future.

Former undisputed cruiserweight champion Usyk moved up weight and made his heavyweight bow against Chazz Witherspoon earlier in the month - earning a technical knockout victory in the seventh round.

The 32-year-old Ukrainian now has his sights on bigger things and is looking for a fight with Wilder in the future.

Oleksandr Usyk earned victory over Chazz Witherspoon as he made his heavyweight debut

Usyk has been boldly backed to overcome Deontay Wilder if the pair were to meet in the future

And his friend and compatriot Lomachenko believes Usyk could overcome the best heavyweight boxers on the planet - most specifically Wilder.

When asked how Usyk would fare against the American, Lomachenko told ESNews: 'He will school Deontay Wilder.'

Wilder has previously had his say regarding Usyk, dismissing the Ukrainian as 'too small'.

'Oleksandr Usyk isn't a threat to me. He's too small for me,' Wilder told Sky.

'I mean, he does a lot of movement, and stuff like that, but that don't faze me.'
description: Vasyl Lomachenko has boldly predicted that Oleksandr Usyk (left) would 'school' heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder (right) if they go head-to-head in the future.
